question:
Declare an integer variable `integer_num` 
and assign it any integer value.

Cast `integer_num` to a float.

Declare a float variable `float_num` and assign it any float value.

Cast float_num to an integer.

Declare a string variable `str_num` and assign it a numeric string.

Cast str_num to an integer.

Declare a string variable `str_float` and assign it a floating-point numeric string.

Cast `str_float` to a float.

Declare an integer variable `num` and assign it any integer value.

Cast `num` to a string.

Declare a float variable `float_value` and assign it any float value.

Cast `float_value` to a string.

Declare an integer variable `age`, 25, and a string variable message, `"I am "`.
Concatenate them.
pythonSolution:
age = 25
message = "I am "
combined_message = message + str(age) + " years old."
